fermentables.notes: Traditional European-style malt suitable for all pilsner types
fermentables.name: Europils Malt

fermentables.notes: Toasted Wheat Malt can add bready and nutty flavours to different types of beer. It will improve head retention and is used at up to 10% inclusion for Ales and 50% for wheat beers.
fermentables.name: Toasted Wheat Malt

yeasts.name: Verdant IPA
yeasts.description: Apricot with notes of tropical fruit and citrus. Leaves a soft and balanced malt profile with slightly more body than a typical American IPA yeast strain.

hops.notes: Bred from Challenger and Northdown. Not as harsh as Target, but very mild aromatics so used in combination with other varieties for late-hopping and dry hopping. Compact cones with high Alpha levels and a subtle but pleasant fresh hoppy aroma.Provides good background bitterness for beers where large quantities of very low alpha aroma hops such as Fuggles/ Goldings are typically used, e.g. English Bitters, Pale Ales and IPA’s, or with Aramis/ Saaz in Continental or Czech Pilsners
hops.name: Admiral
hops.usedIn: nglish Bitters, Pale Ales and IPA’s, Continental or Czech Pilsners

hops.name: First Gold
hops.notes: The variety is very suitable both as a general kettle hop and also for late and dry hopping in all types of beer. First Gold has good aroma and bittering qualities, much of the flavour of WGV seems to have been retained but with an added extra citrus quality, produces a well-balanced bitterness and a fruity, slightly spicy note in ales. An orangey quality has been observed in many beers brewed using this variety.

hops.name: Archer
hops.notes: A new variety from the Charles Faram Hop program. Classic British aroma with a citrus twist. Aroma is floral with delicate hints of lime and peach. Provides traditional British assertiveness.
